title: Density-Based Clustering via Rust
text: R bindings petal-clustering Rust library, providing fast density-based clustering via DBSCAN, HDBSCAN, OPTICS.

title: Density-Based Clustering via Rust
text: Requires working Rust toolchain (rustc >= 1.81).

title: Density-Based Clustering via Rust
text: Classical methods like k-means assume convex, evenly-sized clusters. Real data rarely clean. Density-based methods find clusters arbitrary shape naturally separate noise.
code: library(petalcluster)  # -- Cluster with both methods -- km  <- kmeans(rings, centers = 3, nstart = 20) hdb <- petal_hdbscan(rings, min_cluster_size = 15L, min_samples = 5L)  # -- Side-by-side comparison -- cluster_col <- function(labels) {   pal <- c("#E41A1C", "#377EB8", "#4DAF4A", "#984EA3")   cols <- rep("grey60", length(labels))   valid <- !is.na(labels) & labels > 0   cols[valid] <- pal[((labels[valid] - 1L) %% length(pal)) + 1L]   cols }  cluster_pch <- function(labels) ifelse(is.na(labels), 4L, 1L)  par(mfrow = c(1, 2)) plot(rings, col = cluster_col(km$cluster), main =  "k-means (k=3)") plot(rings, col = cluster_col(hdb$cluster), pch = cluster_pch(hdb$cluster), main ="HDBSCAN")

title: Density-Based Clustering via Rust
text: R’s built-quakes dataset contains 1,000 seismic events near Fiji. HDBSCAN finds spatial clusters earthquake activity without needing specify number groups upfront. Use xcol ycol plot single pair variables — longitude vs latitude reveals geographic structure clusters:  default plot produces scatter plot matrix variables:
code: quakes_hdbscan <- petal_hdbscan(   quakes[, c("lat", "long", "depth", "mag")] ) quakes_hdbscan #>  #> ── HDBSCAN Clustering #> Metric: "euclidean" #> Parameters: alpha = 1, min_samples = 15, min_cluster_size = 15 #> Clusters: 8, Noise points: 199 plot(quakes_hdbscan, xcol = "long", ycol = "lat", asp=1) plot(quakes_hdbscan)

title: HDBSCAN Clustering — petal_hdbscan
code: petal_hdbscan(   x,   alpha = 1,   min_samples = 15L,   min_cluster_size = 15L,   metric = c("euclidean", "cosine"),   boruvka = TRUE,   partial_labels = NULL )

title: HDBSCAN Clustering — petal_hdbscan
text: x numeric matrix data frame. Data frames coerced matrix using numeric columns (non-numeric columns dropped). alpha Smoothing parameter mutual reachability distance. Default 1.0. min_samples Minimum neighbourhood size. Default 15L. min_cluster_size Minimum cluster size. Default 15L. metric Distance metric, one "euclidean" "cosine". boruvka Whether use Boruvka's algorithm MST construction. Default TRUE. partial_labels Optional named list semi-supervised clustering. Names cluster IDs (strings), values integer vectors 1-indexed point indices. NULL (default) fully unsupervised clustering.

text: object class "petal_hdbscan": list components cluster (integer vector cluster IDs, NA noise), n_clusters, n_noise, data (input matrix), params, metric, outlier_scores (GLOSH scores).

title: Density-Based Clustering via Rust — petalcluster-package
text: R bindings petal-clustering Rust crate Petabi, Inc., providing fast implementations three density-based clustering algorithms: petal_dbscan() — DBSCAN: finds clusters dense regions separated areas lower density. petal_hdbscan() — HDBSCAN: hierarchical extension DBSCAN adapts clusters varying density. petal_optics() — OPTICS: produces reachability ordering captures cluster structure multiple density thresholds. three accept numeric matrices data frames, support Euclidean cosine distance metrics, return S3 objects print() plot() methods.
